results.title: Antidiabetic Drugs Can Reduce the Harmful Impact of Chronic Smoking on Post-Traumatic Brain Injuries
results.text_hl: In conclusion, our findings suggest that @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@MF@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Rosiglitazone @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077154 @@@RSG@@@ could reduce the harmful impact of chronic smoking on @<m>DISEASE_Epilepsy_Post_Traumatic</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D004834 @@@post-traumatic brain injuries@@@.

citations.NLM: Sivandzade F, Alqahtani F, Dhaibar H, Cruz-Topete D, Cucullo L. Antidiabetic Drugs Can Reduce the Harmful Impact of Chronic Smoking on Post-Traumatic Brain Injuries Int J Mol Sci. 2023 Mar 25;24(7):. PMID: 37047198

results.title: Metformin reduces neuroinflammation and improves cognitive functions after traumatic brain injury.
results.text_hl: Here, we show the @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus @DISEASE_MESH:D003920 @@@diabetes@@@ drug, @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@, significantly improves cognitive functions after controlled @<m>DISEASE_Epilepsy_Post_Traumatic</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D004834 @@@cortical impact@@@ (@<m>DISEASE_Epilepsy_Post_Traumatic</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D004834 @@@CCI) injury@@@ in @SPECIES_10090 @@@mice@@@, showing improved spatial learning and nest building.

citations.NLM: DiBona VL, Shah MK, Krause KJ, Zhu W, Voglewede MM, Smith DM, Crockett DP, Zhang H. Metformin reduces neuroinflammation and improves cognitive functions after traumatic brain injury. Neurosci Res. 2021 Nov;172():99-109. PMID: 34023358
citations.BibTeX: @article{34023358, title={Metformin reduces neuroinflammation and improves cognitive functions after traumatic brain injury.}, author={DiBona VL and Shah MK and Krause KJ and Zhu W and Voglewede MM and Smith DM and Crockett DP and Zhang H}, journal={Neurosci Res}, volume={172}, pages={99-109}}

results.title: The PIKASO trial (Preventing Injured Knees from Osteoarthritis: Severity Outcomes): Rationale and design features for a randomized controlled trial.
results.text_hl: Objective: Given the high burden and increasing prevalence of @<m>DISEASE_Epilepsy_Post_Traumatic</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D004834 @@@post-traumatic osteoarthritis@@@ (@<m>DISEASE_Epilepsy_Post_Traumatic</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D004834 @@@PTOA@@@), identifying clinically beneficial strategies to prevent or delay its onset could improve the quality of life of those at high risk of developing the disease.

citations.NLM: Jacobs CA, Jones MH, Collins JE, Waddell LM, Li X, Winalski CS, Pietrosimone B, Kraus VB, Otero M, Wellsandt E, Schmitt LC, Spindler KP, Anderson DD, Rodeo SA, Magnussen RA, Wolf BR, Hart JM, Stone AV, Conley CE, Golightly YM, Myer GD, Snyder-Mackler L, Lotz MK, Kim JS, McLeod MM, Huebner JL, Lisee C, Selzer F, Katz JN, Long K, Frier KC, Betensky DJ, Felson DT, Losina E, for PIKASO Team. The PIKASO trial (Preventing Injured Knees from Osteoarthritis: Severity Outcomes): Rationale and design features for a randomized controlled trial. Osteoarthr Cartil Open. 2025 Mar;7(1):100563. PMID: 39867299
